content.raw: Sorry for the confusing comments, @mohamd_ayman . Can you bring the legacy back please?
content.html: Sorry for the confusing comments, @mohamd_ayman . Can you bring the legacy back please?

content.raw:
From the documentation https://packages.debian.org/sid/nodejs-legacy

This package contains a symlink for legacy Node.js code requiring binary to be /usr/bin/node (not /usr/bin/nodejs as provided in Debian)

The package is useful because node is installed as nodejs by default on some machines.
content.html:
From the documentation https://packages.debian.org/sid/nodejs-legacy

This package contains a symlink for legacy Node.js code requiring binary to be /usr/bin/node (not /usr/bin/nodejs as provided in Debian)

The package is useful because node is installed as nodejs by default on some machines.

content.raw: Oh wait, but you haven't removed it yet, right? It shows as if it's still there.
content.html: Oh wait, but you haven't removed it yet, right? It shows as if it's still there.

content.raw:
'sudo apt-get install nodejs-legacy' will install 0.10.25 which is not supported by gazebojs, thats why I removed it.
http://packages.ubuntu.com/trusty/nodejs-legacy
content.html: 'sudo apt-get install nodejs-legacy' will install 0.10.25 which is not supported by gazebojs, thats why I removed it. http://packages.ubuntu.com/trusty/nodejs-legacy
